answers.question: Telegram Handle We Can Use To Contact You
Link to your Public Group Chat
Have you participated in a previous Gitcoin Grants Round? If so, please name the rounds or link the builder profile associated with previous rounds.

answers.answer:
Alfred contributes to the Open Source Software (OSS) ecosystem by lowering the barrier to designing and launching decentralized bounties‚Äîa mechanism increasingly used to incentivize OSS contributions in climate, public goods, and community-led domains.

üîß **Composable AI Components:** Alfred is built using open-source tools from LangChain, LangGraph, and Streamlit. We extend these components with tailored prompt engineering, memory systems, and microtask generators, which can be reused by others creating task coordination agents.

üå± **Enabling Purpose-Driven OSS Projects:** By offering a structured way to design and deploy sustainability-focused bounties, Alfred helps communities define actionable problems that attract open-source contributors. This creates a clear demand signal for new projects (e.g., open hardware for clean water) or for data-driven micro-contributions (e.g., geo-tagged pollution monitoring), expanding the scope of OSS beyond traditional dev tools.

üß† **Knowledge Infrastructure:** As Alfred evolves, it aims to integrate knowledge bases (impact frameworks, case studies, past successful OSS initiatives in climate), making it a tool that curates and disseminates open knowledge.
answers.question: How does your project contribute to the growth of the OSS ecosystem? Please provide specific examples of how your application enhances or expands the current ecosystem.

answers.answer:
**Alfred** is a smart assistant for decentralized bounty creation, focused on **climate action and sustainability use cases.**

Differentiators:
üß© **Structured Bounty Generator:** Instead of just brainstorming, Alfred generates a full **bounty spec**, including microtasks (action, verification, instruction), eligibility/evaluation criteria, and best practices.


üì• **Downloadable Outputs:** After interacting with Alfred, users get a ready-to-use Markdown spec, making it easy to share or post on bounty platforms like Atlantis or Gitcoin.


üó∫Ô∏è **Domain-Specific Agent:** Unlike general-purpose agents, Alfred‚Äôs prompts and behavior are **finely tuned to sustainability**, helping users focus on local relevance, clarity of impact, and measurable goals.


üìö **Microtask Framework:** Users can define bounties that go beyond code‚Äîlike uploading geo-tagged data, creating awareness content, or collecting field evidence‚Äîmaking it more inclusive to non-coders.
answers.question: What features or use cases does your dApp/App present? How is it differentiated?

answers.answer:
**Bounty Publishing Integration ‚Äì** One-click export of the generated spec to platforms like Gitcoin, Dework, or Atlantis Impact Foundry (JSON schema + Markdown).


**Bounty Templates Library ‚Äì** Preloaded bounty examples (e.g., for plastic waste cleanups or rainwater harvesting audits) to help users get started faster.


**Embedded Impact Frameworks ‚Äì** Let users choose from verified impact measurement models and incorporate them directly into bounty evaluation criteria.


**Multi-lingual Support ‚Äì** Localized bounty generation in languages like Hindi, Swahili, and Spanish to enable wider access.
answers.question: What are your plans for further development, and how will the grant funds be used to achieve these goals?

For any project deploying smart contracts on blockchain networks, please list all your deployer addresses and their corresponding blockchain networks. Use this format for each entry: [deployer_address], [chain_id]‚Äîfor example, 0x123abc..., 42161 (This represents a deployer address on the Arbitrum network). Please include a separate line for each unique deployer address and blockchain combination.

project.title: Atlantis
project.description:
A Home for Changemakers üî±üåè
Building coordination tech for climate resilience & regeneration ü§ù

# Introduction to Atlantis

Atlantis is a collective of makers and creators building coordination tech to accelerate climate action and social impact.

We build a range of tools for initiating, implementing and reporting the impact of climate and social projects. Our aim is to make it easier for NGOs, Social Enterprises, Impact DAOs to digitise their impact creation, fundraising & team management.

Our products and services are geared to make existing organizations effective while making it easier for new organizations to bloom.

# Mission 

## Accelerating Resilience and Regeneration

Our mission is two fold, on one side Resilience, with rising climate shocks we will need to defend our water, food, energy supply lines. Defend them from floods, droughts, wildfires and other climate events. 

On the other side is Regeneration. While we build resilience to mitigate climate change and adapt to it, we also need to actively accelerate removal and reduction of GHG by making regenerative life support systems more accessible.

[![Vision-Mission.png](https://i.postimg.cc/TwvFc7BC/Vision-Mission.png)](https://postimg.cc/Y48dr3rW)

# Vision

We dream of a future where humans finally decouple progress from the current degenerative systems to more regenerative systems. A future where we realize there is no economic wellness without ecological wellness. Like Buckminster Fuller says, what we need is a design revolution, one which will make it possible for Spaceship Earth to work for ALL.

### Accelerating the coordination and creation of credible impact. End to end impact workflow on-chain.

[![End-to-End-Impact-Workflow.jpg](https://i.postimg.cc/sD3BL3pR/End-to-End-Impact-Workflow.jpg)](https://postimg.cc/mh62zfXd)

# What we have done in the last 6 months


- Launched initial version of [Impact Foundry](https://impactfoundry.atlantisp2p.com/login), and currently evaluating and implementing feedback. 
- Working on the design of Impact Miner 2.0. Version 1.0 is available on [Android](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.company.atlantis&hl=en_IN&pli=1) and [Apple IOS](https://apps.apple.com/in/app/impact-miner/id6448894610) App Stores. 
- Presented an in-depth report in multiple forums. The report was prepared in collaboration with CCI (Crypto Council for Innovation) and MCV (Mercy Corps Ventures) of the Pilot in Rural India that proves how Atlantis' coordination tech can be used for developing peer to peer resource management networks. [Report Link](https://docsend.com/view/sgra3t5k7amrjqw7)
- [Alfred v0.2](https://alfredv0.streamlit.app/) is complete. Alfred is an AI-powered assistant designed to create impactful, measurable, and actionable bounties for climate and sustainability initiatives. 
- 80% of development is completed on [Impact Landscapes](https://landscapes-vert.vercel.app/), using Atlantis' Anchor Protocol which helps fund outcomes in different parts of the world.
- Helping build a Regen Marketplace using Atlantis Anchor Protocol for Urbanika. 




# Current Progress:

Impact Miner: 
- Version 1.0 is live on app stores with 4,500+ users as of today. 
- Version 2.0 design has been completed.


Impact Foundry:
- Version 1.0 is in early access, being tested by our clients. 
- Version 1.1 is under development.


Impact Landscapes:
- 80% of the work is complete.


Alfred (Open-Source Project):
- v0.2 is complete and currently being tested by the Octant community.


Greenpill NFT Collection:
- Backend development is 100% complete.



# Team
[![Screenshot-2024-07-27-at-6-25-11-PM.png](https://i.postimg.cc/XYKH2T5F/Screenshot-2024-07-27-at-6-25-11-PM.png)](https://postimg.cc/0zQ0jXc2)


# Bio:

***Irthu Suresh*** - Cofounder and CEO. Degree: Mechanical Engineer graduated in 2013. 7 years of working in climate solutions. Lead designer of Impact Miner. In charge of Business Development and Marketing. 

***Nakul Reddy*** - Cofounder and COO. Degree: Masters in Engineering Management and Bachelors in Mechanical Engineering. 7 Years of working in climate solutions. Leads impact assessment and reporting framework development. 

***Faisal Khan*** - Frontend Developer and Blockchain Integrations for Impact Miner. Degree: CS Engineer graduated in 2023

***Shubham Singh*** - Backend and Blockchain Lead for Impact Miner and Impact Foundry Degree: CS Engineer graduated in 2021

***Madhav Sampat*** - Social Media, Marketing and Community Building. Degree: Hospitality and Management, graduated in 2021

***Devanshi Patel*** - Lead Designer for Impact Foundry and supporting UX development for Impact Miner. Degree - Graduate from Srishti Design School, graduated in 2023

***Himanshu Rana*** - Lead Frontend Developer for Impact Foundry. Degree - CS Engineer graduated in 2022
